即係哈哈哈email問既野根本唔係爭論點 只係想轉移視線
爭論點從來都係講緊係咪有shortage就一定有non-price competition
而哈哈哈封email係咁問: "when excessive demand appears, it may imply price competition may exist too? instead of implying that there is non-price competition only?"
即係話佢都同意左有shortage就會有non-price competition 否定左佢自己mock既答案

replies.msg: 當demand升或者supply跌，去新equilibrium既原因，係因為有shortage wor
答案2同3根本都係may, shortage指在某一價格時供不應求，唔單只p=0。有shortage, 隱含住現時價格太低，人們要付出更多成本，可以係金錢，可以係時間，即係2同3都有機會啱。但最重要係necessarily imply喎，如果2 同3 都係有機會啱而不一定啱, 即係唔啱囉

真心求教
我覺得只有(1)係necessarily imply
有無non-price competition其實要睇allocation方式
Eg. 假設 渣打馬拉松 報名費(price)係$300 under呢個case supply係100000個 demand係200000
而報名方法就係指定period內上渣打網報名畀錢 唔會先到先得 shortage嘅話就由抽籤決定
呢個case內allocation方式已經規限咗抽籤 而只要喺指定period內報名就得 唔使排隊(assume個網唔會塞)
無非金錢成本 無其他競爭方式 最後由渣打以抽籤進行allocation
咁算唔算無non-price competition嘅例子 有錯請指正

Eg. 假設 渣打馬拉松 報名費(price)係$300 under呢個case supply係100000個 demand係200000
而報名方法就係指定period內上渣打網報名畀錢 唔會先到先得 shortage嘅話就由抽籤決定
呢個case內allocation方式已經規限咗抽籤 而只要喺指定period內報名就得 唔使排隊(assume個網唔會塞)
無非金錢成本 無其他競爭方式 最後由渣打以抽籤進行allocation

正確的分析，是如果價格被管制在市價之下，需求的一群見到自己的邊際用值高於價格，競爭搶購不獲，逼着要付出金錢價格之外的其他代價來作補充而爭取。這些其他的補充準則可能是排隊輪購，可能是論資排輩、武力解決、政治手法、人際關係等等。只要知道哪一種補充金錢價格的準則會被採用，或哪幾種準則的合併會被採用，我們就知道補充準則的代價，加上金錢之價，會等於邊際用值。

有一些社會——比如極端的共產社會——市場不存在，沒有價格，但代價（sacrifice）還是要付出的。

－張五常《經濟解釋》

Wiki
Non-price competition refers to a situation where one of the following two things happens:

Buyers compete with each other to acquire a good on a basis other than price. Such competition occurs in a situation of excess demand: at the given price, the demand for the good exceeds the supply. The typical cause for excess demand is a price ceiling, though it may also be caused by sticky prices or unforeseen dramatic changes in supply or demand.

好似係咁？

replies.msg:
There is no shortage even in a society, for the simple reason that all markets must be “cleared” in order to produce equilibrium situations. If equilibrium is not attained, no theory is implied, hence economics cannot explain behaviour. If the price of a good is controlled to below the market price, the alleged presence of the shortage, hence disequilibrium, simply means that we have no theory. It is not a fact. If queuing occurs, equilibrium may again be derived as a matter of routine, but then the market is again cleared—hence no shortage.
唔係shortage唔會發生，正因為發生shortage,所以一定會出現價格/非價格競爭/both。我完全唔明點解你否定咗P可以上升嘅可能，shortage嘅出現一定係p受到價格control?如果主要石油出口國突現減產，需求不變，供應減少嘅情況下，係咪出現shortage?油價係咪會升?唔好話咩唔講equilibrium,imply就係講之後嘅野，你自己諗一諗先答

我理解係有shortage出現， by defn 即係 At P1, Qd>Qs , 資源唔可以有效分配，通常都暗示price 係set 死左，唔可以用price 解決，即係暗示有non price competition.

至於price competition , 如果price 可以解決，eqm market 下，Qd= Qs 唔會出現shortage , 即使demand / supply change 都好， At eqm 都係no shortage .

總括， 有shortage 出現即係price 解決唔到，即係implies 有non price 出現。

好似黃子華， 一早set 定 380 480 780 呢d 票， 大把人覺得抵afford 到，自然Qd > Qs , 有人肯比貴票既同時都一定因為有non price 出現（哂時間mon住或者排隊買票）， 如果一開始定一票岩岩到Eqm price i.e. $3000，咁Qd= Qs唔會有shortage.

好似係咁？

利申，AL 補過cliff

唔一定
有shortage只係因為p1嘅Qd>Qs，佢可以透過price competition提升價格去到equilibrium level，咁就會冇shortage，有price competition唔代表冇shortage，只係price competition會令市價自動調節去到均衡價格，但係佢未必即時冇晒shortage，調節完之前都仲會有shortage
但係假設cliff個例子price=0，或者有price ceiling令到價格唔可以高過p1，咁我地就冇得透過price competition去分配資源，我地只有用non-price competition分配

replies.msg: 我都有諗過Qd > Qs 時， price increase , Qd decrease , then to eqm , Qd = Qs 就冇shortage , 因為以前書係咁教。但以上呢個情況只係反映市場調節至均衡既過程 , by defn 均衡價格， Qd = Qs 係 no shortage no surplus（ 唔會未必即時冇哂shortage) , 暗示如果有shortage （即係由price competition 達至唔到eqm) , 即係一定有non price 出現.

replies.msg:
你冇get錯我意思。

(係度我先唔引進張五常果種對shortage, surplus, equilibrium果種獨特看法，雖然我本人係認同。)

其實shortage imply non-price competition，呢個道理好簡單，冇爭議。跟住重點係排隊只係其中一種non-price competition，所以我講排隊只係可能會發生，係因為可以有其他方式嘅non-price competition。
甚至倒返轉頭，冇shortage，都係可以有排隊呢個情況添。好簡單，你去超市比錢排長龍，係咪就代表有所謂shortage先?

至於點verify有shortage/surplus，其實係睇下有冇一啲non-price competition behavior，視乎唔同market有唔同behavior。不過其實verify係代表事後望返轉頭，如果要推斷將來會有什麼non-price competition behavior其實係困難好多。

講真唔理邊個啱邊個錯，聽日考今日咳咳仲黎搞9哈哈，搞到佢啲學生冇曬信心，其實都真係幾冇道德。
不過如果真係出錯題目搞到啲學生錯concept都真係唔啱

其實只係定義問題，搞清咗定義，其實好多討論都好無謂

1. Price competition & non-price competition：

Shortage = demand > supply

所以呢度嘅competition係指buyers用咩方法競爭，所以唔關商家點競爭、點分配資源事。

2. Shortage

Shortage包唔包括短暫demand>supply，然後用price變返equalibrium？

以下取自Wiki：

In a perfect market, an excess of demand will prompt sellers to increase prices until demand at that price matches the available supply, establishing market equilibrium.


In perfect market, 雙方會以調節price達至equalibrium。

In economic terminology, a shortage occurs when for some reason (such as government intervention, or decisions by sellers not to raise prices) the price does not rise to reach equilibrium. In this circumstance, buyers want to purchase more at the market price than the quantity of the good or service that is available, and some non-price mechanism (such as "first come, first served" or a lottery) determines which buyers are served. So in a perfect market the only thing that can cause a shortage is price.


睇完呢段會清楚哂。Price出現問題無得競爭（有錢唔係大哂）先至會導致Shortage，所以呢個定義下：

Price competition failed -> shortage -> non-price competition

And of course有scarsity先有competition先有shortage

所以唔駛理會短暫定長遠，淨係睇定義已經冇得揀，(1) & (3)。

利申：冇讀過Econ

quote.msg: 佢地既邏輯下，係連shortage都唔會發生，唔需要討論有咩競爭。

There is no shortage even in a society, for the simple reason that all markets must be “cleared” in order to produce equilibrium situations. If equilibrium is not attained, no theory is implied, hence economics cannot explain behaviour. If the price of a good is controlled to below the market price, the alleged presence of the shortage, hence disequilibrium, simply means that we have no theory. It is not a fact. If queuing occurs, equilibrium may again be derived as a matter of routine, but then the market is again cleared—hence no shortage.
唔係shortage唔會發生，正因為發生shortage,所以一定會出現價格/非價格競爭/both。我完全唔明點解你否定咗P可以上升嘅可能，shortage嘅出現一定係p受到價格control?如果主要石油出口國突現減產，需求不變，供應減少嘅情況下，係咪出現shortage?油價係咪會升?唔好話咩唔講equilibrium,imply就係講之後嘅野，你自己諗一諗先答

replies.msg: 最慘係做錯題目 錯條最簡單既

A Market Shortage occurs when there is excess demand- that is quantity demanded is greater than quantity supplied.  In this situation, consumers won't be able to buy as much of a good as they would like.  In response to the demand of the consumers, producers will raise both the price of their product and the quantity they are willing to supply.  The increase in price will be too much for some consumers and they will no longer demand the product.  Meanwhile the increased quantity of available product will satisfy other consumers.  Eventually equilibrium will be reached.

quote.msg:
其實只係定義問題，搞清咗定義，其實好多討論都好無謂

1. Price competition & non-price competition：

Shortage = demand > supply

所以呢度嘅competition係指buyers用咩方法競爭，所以唔關商家點競爭、點分配資源事。

2. Shortage

Shortage包唔包括短暫demand>supply，然後用price變返equalibrium？

以下取自Wiki：

In a perfect market, an excess of demand will prompt sellers to increase prices until demand at that price matches the available supply, establishing market equilibrium.


In perfect market, 雙方會以調節price達至equalibrium。

In economic terminology, a shortage occurs when for some reason (such as government intervention, or decisions by sellers not to raise prices) the price does not rise to reach equilibrium. In this circumstance, buyers want to purchase more at the market price than the quantity of the good or service that is available, and some non-price mechanism (such as "first come, first served" or a lottery) determines which buyers are served. So in a perfect market the only thing that can cause a shortage is price.


睇完呢段會清楚哂。Price出現問題無得競爭（有錢唔係大哂）先至會導致Shortage，所以呢個定義下：

Price competition failed -> shortage -> non-price competition

And of course有scarsity先有competition先有shortage

所以唔駛理會短暫定長遠，淨係睇定義已經冇得揀，(1) & (3)。

quote.msg:
其實只係定義問題，搞清咗定義，其實好多討論都好無謂

1. Price competition & non-price competition：

Shortage = demand > supply

所以呢度嘅competition係指buyers用咩方法競爭，所以唔關商家點競爭、點分配資源事。

2. Shortage

Shortage包唔包括短暫demand>supply，然後用price變返equalibrium？

以下取自Wiki：

In a perfect market, an excess of demand will prompt sellers to increase prices until demand at that price matches the available supply, establishing market equilibrium.


In perfect market, 雙方會以調節price達至equalibrium。

In economic terminology, a shortage occurs when for some reason (such as government intervention, or decisions by sellers not to raise prices) the price does not rise to reach equilibrium. In this circumstance, buyers want to purchase more at the market price than the quantity of the good or service that is available, and some non-price mechanism (such as "first come, first served" or a lottery) determines which buyers are served. So in a perfect market the only thing that can cause a shortage is price.


睇完呢段會清楚哂。Price出現問題無得競爭（有錢唔係大哂）先至會導致Shortage，所以呢個定義下：

Price competition failed -> shortage -> non-price competition

And of course有scarsity先有competition先有shortage

所以唔駛理會短暫定長遠，淨係睇定義已經冇得揀，(1) & (3)。

Shortage 邊係D>S

「唯一不會導致租值消散的約束競爭準則是市價。把價格管制到低於市場水平，以「先到先得」取代「價高者得」分配公路使用權，爭先恐後大排長龍都是浪費時間的租值消散。問題來了，既然只有市價不會導致租值消散，何解市場上不時還有排隊輪候的情況出現呢？答案當然是使用市場亦有其交易費用。沒有交易費用便沒有市場，是張五常說的。把交易費用與租值消散劃上等號，使用市場亦難免會導致租值消散。」

quote.msg:
其實只係定義問題，搞清咗定義，其實好多討論都好無謂

1. Price competition & non-price competition：

Shortage = demand > supply

所以呢度嘅competition係指buyers用咩方法競爭，所以唔關商家點競爭、點分配資源事。

2. Shortage

Shortage包唔包括短暫demand>supply，然後用price變返equalibrium？

以下取自Wiki：

In a perfect market, an excess of demand will prompt sellers to increase prices until demand at that price matches the available supply, establishing market equilibrium.


In perfect market, 雙方會以調節price達至equalibrium。

In economic terminology, a shortage occurs when for some reason (such as government intervention, or decisions by sellers not to raise prices) the price does not rise to reach equilibrium. In this circumstance, buyers want to purchase more at the market price than the quantity of the good or service that is available, and some non-price mechanism (such as "first come, first served" or a lottery) determines which buyers are served. So in a perfect market the only thing that can cause a shortage is price.


睇完呢段會清楚哂。Price出現問題無得競爭（有錢唔係大哂）先至會導致Shortage，所以呢個定義下：

Price competition failed -> shortage -> non-price competition

And of course有scarsity先有competition先有shortage

所以唔駛理會短暫定長遠，淨係睇定義已經冇得揀，(1) & (3)。

replies.msg:
補充標準AL答案
DSE學生可以不理
There is no shortage even in a society, for the simple reason that all markets must be “cleared” in order to produce equilibrium situations. If equilibrium is not attained, no theory is implied, hence economics cannot explain behaviour. If the price of a good is controlled to below the market price, the alleged presence of the shortage, hence disequilibrium, simply means that we have no theory. It is not a fact. If queuing occurs, equilibrium may again be derived as a matter of routine, but then the market is again cleared—hence no shortage.

replies.msg:
需求曲線與供應曲線皆意圖之物，真實世界不存在；這二線相交的均衡點是空中樓閣，真實世界也不存在；價格有管制而出現的「剩餘」或「短缺」更無稽，不僅觀察不到，簡直不知所謂。我在《科學說需求》中對「短缺」有如下的評述：

「價格被管制在市價之下，莫名其妙的『短缺』出現，不均衡，世界大亂矣！問題是人與人之間對任何物品的競爭，必定要解決。說『不均衡』，是說沒有解決的辦法。『不均衡』的意思，是指沒有可以被事實驗證的假說。什麼『壓力』云云，不可以壓出一些假說來……『短缺』是因為經濟學者的思想有所短缺而產生的。」

這就是麻煩：整個需求曲線與供應曲線相交的均衡分析，在真實世界可以觀察到的只是價格及其變動，其他皆屬子虛烏有。至於「量」，我們見到的只是產量及成交量，意圖的需求量與供應量是經濟學者的想像，不是實物。然而，我們就是要把這樣的「理論」來解釋複雜無比的可以觀察到的世事，成功的機會不可能只基於一些曲線的交叉。深入的曲線之內的闡釋，概念的正確掌握，侷限變化的慎重調查，等等，皆不可或缺。
